page.title: 19THE THATCHER, NR. COVENTRY.
page.content: The thatcher lives in a picturesque cottage in Rugby Road, Brandon, with his wife and two teenage children. {* * * * * He learnt his trade from an old man in Northamptonshire. He has been thatching for about fifteen years. It takes him about six to eight weeks to thatch an average sized cottage but it can take a lot longer. He is one of only a very few thatchers in the area. He has a young apprentice who is learning this dying art. { * * * * * The thatcher uses three different materials. He uses two straw varieties or thatch, one called long straw and one called combed wheat. He also uses Norfolk reed. In the past he has used rice straw, marsh sedge and heather.
